items.title: The best robot vacuums we've tested for 2025
items.author: Jennifer Pattison Tuohy
items.summary:
- The Roborock S8 MaxV Ultra is highly praised for its *excellent vacuum performance*, *advanced AI-powered obstacle detection*, and *hands-free operation* with features like auto-empty and auto-refill mop tanks.  
- Testing focuses on vacuuming and mopping efficiency, brush quality, bin capacity, app usability, runtime, and mapping with SLAM technology to ensure thorough and convenient cleaning.  
- The guide offers options tailored for different needs, including budget models, mopping preferences, and pet hair management, ensuring a robot vacuum is available for nearly every home and lifestyle.

items.title: Figma is going public
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
*Figma, a collaborative interface design platform, has filed for an IPO, trading under 'FIG'.*
*The company was nearly acquired by Adobe for $20 billion in 2022, but the deal was scrapped due to regulator pressure.
*Figma's revenue grew to $228.2 million, with significant investments in AI to enhance design workflows.*

Ultra Mobile increases data caps without raising prices
items.author: Cameron Faulkner
items.summary:
*Ultra Mobile has upgraded its plans with higher data caps and more international perks, *all while maintaining current prices.*
- The $39/month plan now offers 24GB of data, up from 15GB, with international data in Mexico included.
- The $59/month unlimited plan includes more hotspot data, international calling credits, and roaming features.
- Ultra Mobile differentiates itself by offering extensive international calling, free calls to many countries, and Wi-Fi calling support, *enhancing global connectivity for users.*

items.title: The GOP’s big spending bill could kill renewable energy projects
Here are the best Kindle deals right now
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- Amazon offers various Kindle models, including the entry-level Kindle, Kindle Kids, Kindle Paperwhite, and Kindle Paperwhite Kids, each with unique features and pricing starting from $109.99 for the basic model.  
- Kindle devices come in ad-supported and ad-free versions, with ad-supported models being about $20 cheaper but displaying personalized ads on lock and home screens.  
- The upcoming Amazon Prime Day on July 8th promises up to 25% off select Kindle models and bundles, though current deals are mostly at full retail prices across major retailers like Amazon, Best Buy, and Target.

items.title: Sonos is offering a refurbished Era 100 for just $119
MLS Season Pass is 50% Off for Apple's 2025 Soccer Coverage
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- The *MLS Season Pass* offers every remaining Major League Soccer match in 1080p, including the Leagues Cup, All-Star Game, playoffs, and Sunday Night Soccer, now at 50% off for $49. 
- Apple TV Plus subscribers get an additional $10 discount, making it only $39, with no regional blackouts and access to the MLS 360 show for highlights and analysis.
- Pass holders can share access with up to five family members and stream across multiple devices, but should note the subscription auto-renews at regular price after the promo period.

items.title: Laptop Mag is shutting down after 35 years
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary: - *Laptop Mag*, a tech publication with nearly 35 years of history, is shutting down as per a decision by its owner, Future PLC. - The brand started in 1991 as a print guide, moved digital in 2013, and was acquired by Future PLC when it bought Purch. - This closure follows shutdowns of other tech sites owned by Future PLC and raises uncertainty about access to *Laptop Mag*'s archives.

items.title: Nothing Headphone 1 review: head-turning
items.author: Andru Marino
items.summary:
- The $299 Nothing Headphone 1 features a unique retro-transparent design, comfortable ear pads, and competitive sound quality with good noise cancellation for city and travel use.  
- Its controls include a roller for volume and playback modes, a paddle button for track skipping, and a customizable button via the Nothing X app, with special integration with Nothing Phone 3.  
- However, call quality is poor in noisy environments, the analog jack requires battery power, and the design may not appeal to everyone, making it a better choice for music listening than voice calls.

items.title: Nothing’s over-ear headphones debut with distinctive design
items.author: Dominic Preston
items.summary:
- *Nothing* has launched its first over-ear headphones, named the **Headphone 1**.
- These headphones feature a **distinctive transparent design** with uniquely shaped, touch-friendly buttons.
- They offer high-end features like **active noise canceling**, **spatial audio**, **lossless support**, and a **35-hour battery life**. **Preorders begin July 4th.**

items.title: Nothing’s Phone 3: First True Flagship With Safe Yet Bold Design
items.author: Dominic Preston
items.summary:
- The Nothing Phone 3 is the company's first true flagship priced at $799, featuring a Snapdragon 8S Gen 4 chip, up to 16GB RAM, 512GB storage, a 6.67-inch OLED screen, and improved battery tech with 5150mAh capacity and fast charging.
- Its unique Glyph Matrix uses a dot matrix LED for custom notifications and introduces interactive Glyph Toys games, reflecting a gimmick-free but playful design philosophy.
- The phone includes a new customizable Essential Key for AI-powered features like meeting transcription, marking Nothing's bold entry into premium US markets while maintaining its distinct identity.

items.title: Best AirPods Deals Right Now
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- *Discounts* are available on various *AirPods models*, including AirPods 4, Pro (second-gen), and Max.
- *Current deals* offer significant savings, such as AirPods 4 starting at $119 and AirPods Pro at $199.
- *Apple’s latest models* feature *improved audio*, noise cancellation, and *USB-C compatibility*, with ongoing sales enhancing affordability.

items.title: Apple accuses former Vision Pro engineer of stealing trade secrets
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- Apple is suing Di Liu, a former senior design engineer for the Vision Pro, for allegedly downloading thousands of proprietary documents and joining Snap's product design team without disclosing this information.
- Liu reportedly concealed his new employment and deleted files from his work laptop to hide the data theft, with Apple concerned the stolen info overlaps with Snap's AR Spectacles products.
- Apple seeks financial damages and the return of stolen documents, while Snap denies any related wrongdoing; this follows Apple's ongoing legal actions against former employees misappropriating secrets.

items.title: AT&T Launches Account Lock to Prevent SIM Swapping
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
*AT&T introduces an *Account Lock* feature to safeguard against *SIM swapping* attacks.*
- The feature, accessible via the myAT&T app, prevents unauthorized account changes such as phone number transfers and SIM swaps.
- *SIM swapping* has become more common, allowing attackers to intercept messages and hijack accounts for two-factor authentication codes.
*Other carriers like T-Mobile, Verizon, and Google Fi* already offer similar protections. AT&T began rolling out this year.*

items.title: Threads now has DMs
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Threads has launched **direct messaging (DMs)** for all users aged 18 and older on Android, iOS, and web, allowing private messages between followers or mutual followers on Instagram.
- Currently, only **one-on-one chats** are supported with plans to add message controls, a request folder, group messaging, and inbox filters soon.
- The DMs are protected by Meta's privacy standards but **will not support end-to-end encryption**, and Threads introduced a new “highlighter” feature to emphasize unique perspectives in the feed.

items.title: Trump says he’ll look into deporting Musk as fight over bill escalates
items.author: Richard Lawler
items.summary:
- President Trump has threatened to investigate deporting Elon Musk amid their dispute over the US budget bill, particularly targeting Musk via the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE).
- Musk opposes the budget bill, especially due to the removal of EV tax credits aiding Tesla, and has threatened to start a new political party to primary Republicans supporting the bill.
- Trump claims Musk receives substantial subsidies and without them, Musk might have to cease operations and return to South Africa, escalating tensions between the two figures.

Newark’s air traffic outages were just the tip of the iceberg
items.author: Darryl Campbell
items.summary:
- Newark Liberty International Airport’s recent air traffic control outages highlight a nationwide crisis of aging technology and staffing shortages in the FAA’s air traffic control system.  
- Despite promises of the NextGen air traffic system by 2025, modernization efforts lag far behind schedule, with critical infrastructure still decades old and often unsustainable.  
- The FAA faces a severe shortage of controllers, forcing reduced flight volumes and overwork, with no quick fix in sight beyond sustained funding and political commitment to overhaul the system.

items.title: Cloudflare will now block AI crawlers by default
Tinder’s Mandatory Facial Recognition Check Comes to the US
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- Tinder has introduced a mandatory *Face Check* facial recognition scan for new users in California to verify their identity and combat fake profiles.  
- This involves submitting a short video selfie to confirm the user is a real person and to detect duplicate or impersonated accounts.  
- The feature has been tested with promising results in Colombia and Canada, and Tinder will evaluate the California rollout before expanding nationally.

items.title: Steam can now show you how much frame generation changes your games
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Valve's Steam Client update introduces a detailed performance monitor that dissects frame rates, including frames generated by Nvidia's DLSS and AMD's FSR techniques.
- The monitor offers multiple detail levels, helping users understand both overall FPS and how frame generation affects game smoothness versus actual rendered frames.
- Future updates aim to enhance this tool with hardware performance detection and improved overlays, expanding insights beyond current Windows and common GPU support.

items.title: AT&T denies network fault in Trump's conference call issue
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary: - *AT&T* stated its network was not responsible for disruptions during a conference call involving *President Donald Trump* and faith leaders, blaming an unnamed *conference call platform* instead. - Trump publicly criticized AT&T on Truth Social for equipment failures during the call and suggested changing carriers if rescheduled. - AT&T is investigating the problem to prevent future disruptions but has not identified the specific platform causing the issues.

items.title: The best iPad to buy
The best foldable phone you can buy
items.author: Allison Johnson
items.summary:
- Foldable phones come in two styles: *book-style* (phone + tablet) and *flip-style* (phone + smartwatch), each suited for different users seeking larger screens or compactness.
- The *Google Pixel 9 Pro Fold* is recommended as the best *book-style foldable* for its refined hardware and user-friendly design, despite a slightly downgraded camera.
- For flip-style, the *Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 6* offers all-day battery and software updates, while the *Motorola Razr Ultra* stands out as the most *fun and stylish* foldable, though durability and software support lag behind.

items.title: Apple’s AI Siri might be powered by OpenAI
The Nintendo Switch 2 will be available in-store at Best Buy on July 1st
items.author: Brandon Russell
items.summary:
- The Nintendo Switch 2, launched on June 5th, will be available at Best Buy stores across *45 US states* starting July 1st, easing difficulty in acquiring the console.  
- It has become the *fastest-selling console* ever, with over 3.5 million units sold in four days, featuring a 7.9-inch 1080p display, magnetic Joy-Cons, and improved performance.  
- The Switch 2 standalone system is priced at *$449.99*, with a bundle including *Mario Kart World* costing *$499.99*, plus various accessories available through major retailers.

items.title: I tested a bunch of Switch 2 screen protectors, and these are the best
The government’s Apple antitrust lawsuit is still on
Netflix teams up with NASA to show live rocket launches and spacewalks
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- NASA Plus, launched in November 2023, offers live rocket launches, spacewalks, and stunning views of Earth from the ISS, now accessible on Netflix starting this Summer.
- This partnership makes NASA’s *science and exploration* content more *accessible* to Netflix's global audience of over 700 million, while remaining ad-free and free of additional cost.
- NASA Plus content will still be available for free on NASA’s website and through its app, ensuring a non-exclusive distribution strategy across *multiple platforms*.

items.title: Mark Zuckerberg announces his AI ‘superintelligence’ super-group
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg announced the creation of the Meta Superintelligence Labs, headed by Alexandr Wang, to advance AI research.  
- The group includes former industry leaders and new AI hires from Anthropic, Google DeepMind, and OpenAI, with aggressive hiring strategies involving eight-figure offers.  
- Meta plans to start research on next-generation AI models and explored acquisitions of various AI labs, though no formal offers have yet been made.

items.title: Jackery’s capable, solar-powered generator is nearly half off
items.author: Brandt Ranj
items.summary:
- *Jackery’s Explorer 1000 Power Station V2* offers 1,500 watts output, can power small appliances, and charges multiple devices simultaneously, making it ideal for camping with modern comforts.  
- The package includes a *SolarSaga 200W Portable Solar Panel* that recharges the generator in about 7.5 hours and can be improved to half the time with a second panel.  
- Currently available for $698.99 on Amazon, this is the *lowest price ever* and includes features like an app for monitoring battery status and an Emergency Charging mode for faster recharge.

items.title: Microsoft Authenticator Ends Password Autofill Support
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Microsoft Authenticator will stop supporting password storage and autofill starting July, directing users to Microsoft Edge or other password managers.  
- Saved payment information will be deleted in July, and passwords in August, with automatic syncing of passwords to Microsoft Edge offered.  
- Authenticator will continue supporting *passkeys* for device-based authentication, while focusing password autofill features within Edge for improved management.

items.title: Date Everything: A Romantic Comedy with Political Edge
items.author: Ash Parrish
items.summary:
*Date Everything* subverts expectations with its *deep exploration of human relationships* and *sharp political satire.*
- It features voice-acted characters of diverse backgrounds and inclusive content warnings.
- The game combines humor, adult themes, and clever dialogue, offering a unique twist on the dating sim genre.

  **Scores:** {"scale": 8, "impact": 7, "novelty": 8, "longTermSignificance": 6}
- *Keywords:* dating sim, political satire, voice acting, diversity, humor

items.title: What’s on your desk, Kallie Plagge?
Insta360 Link 2 Webcam Now $50 Off with Advanced Tracking
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- The *Insta360 Link 2* is an affordable ($149.99) 4K webcam with a motorized three-axis gimbal that *actively tracks user movements*, keeping presenters centered during calls or streams.
- It features *AI-powered framing*, allowing automatic zoom and multi-presenter tracking, with customizable no-follow zones to control camera focus.
- Additional software modes focus on workspace, overhead shots, and whiteboard presentations, enhancing productivity without extra gear.
